intro: Psephellus troitzkyi, commonly known as the Troitzky's sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Russia. Due to its adaptations to harsh conditions, it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local ecosystems.
